data.title: Crazy coordinates!
data.statement: You are given two collections of numeric elements. You must output them as comma-separated coordinates pairsin this way "<<(X1, Y1), (X2, Y2), ..., (XN, YN)>>" All X and Y must be in ascending order.
data.constraints:
A.Length == B.Length
A[] Contains [[x]] values in the range -100 < [[x]] < 100
B[] Contains [[x]] values in the range -100 < [[x]] < 100
data.stubGenerator:
read x:string(99)
read y:string(99)
write answer
data.inputDescription: 2 arrays of integer with the same length.
data.outputDescription: A string with all paired coordinates in ascending ordered.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given two collections of numeric elements. You must output them as comma-separated coordinates pairsin this way "(X1, Y1), (X2, Y2), ..., (XN, YN)" All X and Y must be in ascending order.
Input
2 arrays of integer with the same length.
Output
A string with all paired coordinates in ascending ordered.
Constraints
A.Length == B.Length
A[] Contains x values in the range -100 < x < 100
B[] Contains x values in the range -100 < x < 100
Example
Input
1 9 5
2 1 5
Output
(1, 1), (5, 2), (9, 5)
